type.name: Int
type.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

_scalarConfig.name: Int
_scalarConfig.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

type.name: String
type.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

_scalarConfig.name: String
_scalarConfig.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

_directives.name: include
_directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

_directives.name: skip
_directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

__Schema.name: __Schema
__Schema.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

_typeConfig.name: __Schema
_typeConfig.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

types.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

ofType.name: __Type
ofType.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

_typeConfig.name: __Type
_typeConfig.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

ofType.name: __TypeKind
ofType.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

_values.name: SCALAR
_values.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

_values.name: OBJECT
_values.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

_values.name: INTERFACE
_values.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

_values.name: UNION
_values.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

_values.name: ENUM
_values.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

_values.name: INPUT_OBJECT
_values.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

_values.name: LIST
_values.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

_values.name: NON_NULL
_values.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

_enumConfig.name: __TypeKind
_enumConfig.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

SCALAR.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

OBJECT.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

INTERFACE.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

UNION.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

ENUM.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

INPUT_OBJECT.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

LIST.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

NON_NULL.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

ofType.name: __Field
ofType.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

_typeConfig.name: __Field
_typeConfig.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

ofType.name: __InputValue
ofType.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

_typeConfig.name: __InputValue
_typeConfig.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

defaultValue.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.
defaultValue.name: defaultValue

ofType.name: __EnumValue
ofType.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

_typeConfig.name: __EnumValue
_typeConfig.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: types

queryType.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.
queryType.name: queryType

mutationType.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.
mutationType.name: mutationType

subscriptionType.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.
subscriptionType.name: subscriptionType

directives.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

ofType.name: __Directive
ofType.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL’s execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

_typeConfig.name: __Directive
_typeConfig.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL’s execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

ofType.name: __DirectiveLocation
ofType.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

_values.name: QUERY
_values.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

_values.name: MUTATION
_values.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

_values.name: SUBSCRIPTION
_values.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

_values.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
_values.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

_values.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
_values.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

_values.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
_values.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

_enumConfig.name: __DirectiveLocation
_enumConfig.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

QUERY.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

MUTATION.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

SUBSCRIPTION.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

FRAGMENT_DEFINITION.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

FRAGMENT_SPREAD.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

INLINE_FRAGMENT.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

directives.name: directives
